page.title: 17Disasters in Plympton St.M.
page.content: There was a{fire}at Battisford farm which lasted for 24hrs although no animals were lost. More serious and far reaching are the {land losses}from farms due to the A.38 expansion.Ford farm was badly hit and had to sell acres on the north side of the road to another farm.Until this was done the farmer had to herd his cattle across the A.38{holding a red {flag}to warn oncoming drivers. Farmers generally felt that compensation for loss of land was ridiculously low.They also fear{break- {ups}in marriages,for the result is that one half of a farm may be sold off and bought by the local authority for industrial expansion. { Concrete cancer}has been found in one of the bridges over the A.38 and is being remedied.
